Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: There it is. The Crimson Idol. It’s practically vibrating with blood magic.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: That thing is foul, Ambrose. It reeks of darkspawn blood and Venatori rituals. Our employer wants it, but I say we smash it right here.

Choices.Text: We are professionals, Dougal. We take the idol and collect our pay.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Professionals?! That thing is evil! I've had enough of your 'suave' compromises!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Dougal, wait, don't swing that hammer—!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: It's done. Now let's fight our way out of this Maker-forsaken city.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Fine. But you're carrying it. If my skin starts boiling, I'm dropping it in the harbor.

Choices.Text: You're right. No amount of gold is worth unleashing this into the world. Smash it.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Glad to see there's a conscience under that silk shirt, Ambrose.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Don't get used to it. I'm going to complain about the lost payday for a month.

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: They're in the vault! Lock down the estate! No one gets out alive!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Ah. It seems kicking down the front door has finally caught up with us. Weapons ready!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: The guards still think we're auditors. If we walk out calmly, we'll be halfway to Kirkwall before they realize it's gone.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: For once, your silver tongue saved us a headache. Let's move.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: We did it. The idol is secure, and we are wealthy beyond measure. First round at the Hanged Man is on me.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Well, our employer is going to be furious that we smashed his prize. I suggest we lay low... permanently.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: We did the right thing, Ambrose. Someday, you'll realize that pays better than gold.
